meanings.definition: To sleep longer or better than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She always outsleeps her brother on weekends.
meanings.sent2: The cat outsleeps the dog every afternoon.
meanings.sent3: The owl outsleeps the early bird, quite literally!
meanings.sent4: His ability to outsleep even the loudest noises is remarkable.
meanings.sent5: Outsleeps like a champion, she never wakes up before noon.

meanings.sent1: During the holidays, he outsleeps all his friends.
meanings.sent2: The sloth outsleeps all other animals in the jungle.
meanings.sent3: The bear outsleeps the competition, quite literally!
meanings.sent4: Her talent for outsleeping is unmatched in the family.
meanings.sent5: Outsleeps effortlessly, he can nap anywhere at any time.
